definition: sheet/piece of writing/bound set of bamboo slips used for record keeping (old)/classifier for written items: chapter, article

sentences.english: It was a follow-up on something I had written before.
sentences.chinese: 这是我以前已写过的题材的续篇。

sentences.english: The May number of the magazine will contain an exciting continuation of the story.
sentences.chinese: 本杂志五月号将刊载该故事的动人续篇。

sentences.english: Its sequel, Guild Wars 2, is slated to carry on this tradition.
sentences.chinese: 他的续篇，激战2，将继续进行这个传统。

sentences.english: And afterwards she furnished me with the sequel of HeathclifFs history.
sentences.chinese: 这以后她就提供给我关于希刺克厉夫的历史的续篇。

sentences.english: This article is a continuation of our “Successful Relationship” series.
sentences.chinese: 本文是“成功恋爱”系列的续篇。

sentences.english: JKR: Five years, although during that time I was also planning and writing parts of the six sequels.
sentences.chinese: 五年，而那时我也已经在想着着手写后面的六部续篇。

sentences.english: The book of Exodus is really the sequel, then, to the book of Genesis.
sentences.chinese: 出埃及记》其实是《创世纪》的续篇。

definition: serialized/published as a serial (in a newspaper)
to put effort into (work, farming, writing etc)/a masterpiece
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
